name: Comlink (handheld)
reference: Please see page 171 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 186 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 180 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Comlink (long range)
reference: Please see page 171 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 186 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 180 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Holo-messenger
reference: Please see page 171 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 186 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 181 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Small, complex devices about the size of a human hand, holo-messengers are used when a personal touch is needed in the conveyance of a message.

name: Pioneer Long-Range Hypertransceiver
reference: Please see page 100 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Whistler Encryption Module
reference: Please see page 100 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Remote DVI Activator (Short Range)
reference: Please see page 100 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Remote DVI Activator (Long Range)
reference: Please see page 100 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: Useful for those needing to make a speedy getaway, a remote activation controller (also known as a beckon call) is a small, handheld device that can be worn on the wrist or stowed in a pocket.
details: Inexpensive models simply activate the vehicle or ship's engines from no more than five kilometers away and run simple preflight checks, allowing the pilot to take off right away. More advanced beckon calls can summon a vehicle or starship, though the autopilot is only capable of performing simple maneuvers, which can be complicated by weather conditions and other obstacles. Some models can be used to remotely pilot a vehicle or starship via slave circuit, though this requires a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Piloting - Space or Piloting - Planetary check. If purchasing the short range variant, the price is 300 credits and the rarity is 4.

name: Shockhold Hardened Comlink
reference: Please see page 56 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds automatic [FAILURE][FAILURE] to any checks made to decode and understand its transmission and automatic [SUCCESS][SUCCESS] to any checks made to broadcast through a com jammer.

description: This hardened comlink is one of the more popular forms of military-grade communications in the galaxy.
details: The ShockHold adds two automatic Threat results to any checks made to decode and understand its transmissions, and two automatic Advantage results to any checks made to broadcast through a comm jammer.

name: Collar-Amp
reference: Please see page 45 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: This simple device is capable of filtering out surrounding sound by detecting the wearer's voice and amplifying the output sound. It is often used by politicians and law enforcement - but occasionally performers have similar models.

name: Collar-Amp (Upgraded)
reference: Please see page 45 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: HoloNet Relay
reference: Please see page 45 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: Although reserved primarily for military communications, the HoloNet is still used by civilians for communications and media transmission instantly across the galaxy. A relay such as this one may be the only option colonists have to communicate across the galaxy.

name: Communications Media Manipulator
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: Media producers will generally rely on a whole studio to review and edit media for distribution. When on the move however, one needs a smaller and portable solution. This allows for anything between printing posters and enhancing holoprojections.

name: Integrated Public Address System
reference: Please see page 52 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: This is a portable package containing a set of speakers, power pack and microphone. The power unit allows this system to last an hour.

name: False Voice Transmitter
reference: Please see page 111 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When impersonating an individual voice, may upgrade Charm, Coercion, Deception, Leadership, and Negotiation checks once.

description: For years, a multitude of criminal and resistance organizations have utilized homemade devices known as false voice transmitters, or FVTs, to fool the Empire.
details: When impersonating another individual with the aid of an FVT, the user can upgrade the ability of their Charm, Coercion, Deception, Leadership, and Negotiation checks once.

name: Polis Masson Voicebox
reference: Please see page 111 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

name: PTP Link
reference: Please see page 111 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: A PTP (or point-to-point) link is a multichannel personal communications device capable of transmitting audio signals up to twenty-five kilometers.
details: Most modern communications devices are unable to pick up PTP transmissions. With the addition of PTP encryption devices, which can cost up to 1,000 credits, this archaic transmission format is almost undetectable.

name: Verpine Comlink
reference: Please see page 112 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The mode of short-wave telecommunication used by the Verpine is undetectable outside their species.
details: With such a comlink, Verpin communications can be intercepted, and direct communication with the Verpine can be established within a range of 100 kilometers. Verpine may choose different "channels," which the comlink can be tuned to, allowing for discreet communications even in the midst of the largest Verpine colonies.

name: Synthetic Standard Neurotoxin
reference: Please see page 172 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 188 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 181 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (2 doses) [B]Resilience Check[b].  Fail: 5 wound plus 1 strain per [THREAT], extra rounds per [DESPAIR]

name: Synthetic Standard Anesthetic
reference: Please see page 172 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 188 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 181 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (2+ doses) [B]Resilience Check[b].  Fail: 5 strain.  [THREAT] or [THREAT][THREAT]: no free maneuver, [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] or more: Staggered next turn, extra rounds per [DESPAIR]

name: Synthetic Standard Neuroparalytic
reference: Please see page 172 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 188 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 181 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b].  Fail: Stuns for 3 rounds, plus 1 strain per [THREAT], extra rounds per [DESPAIR]

name: Dendriton Toxin
reference: Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b].  Fail: Inflicts 1 strain, 3 strain next turn, 5 strain turn after that.  Suffer [SETBACK] on all checks.  Each [THREAT] inflicts 1 more strain.  [DESPAIR]: Make another check on third turn or suffer 5 more strain.

description: This is an exceedingly lethal neurotoxin which is employed by particularly sadistic individuals, as the poison causes a victim to suffer fatigue and dull pain which progressively gets worse over time.

name: Dioxis Gas
reference: Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI])[b] (2+ doses) [B]Resilience Check[b].  Fail:  Inflicts 5 wound.  Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain.  Lasts 3 rounds.

description: This lethal gas has been in use for decades, extensively used by groups which use droid fighters as they are unaffected.

name: Raquor Venom
reference: Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b].  Fail:  Staggers for 2 rounds.  Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain. [DESPAIR]: Immobilizes for 2 rounds.

description: This poison is extracted from Sriluurian dark wolves and is a powerful paralytic that is generally better than most synthetic options on the market.

name: Bearsloth Venom (dose)
reference: Please see page 22 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper Adventure for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b].  Fail:  Immediate critical injury - [B]Wracking Venom - Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] When suffering wound or strain, suffer 2 more.

name: Bearsloth Antivenom (dose)
reference: Please see page 23 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper Adventure for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gain [BO][BO][BO] to checks to resist bearsloth venom until end of encounter, or immediate remove on instance of [B]Wracking Venom[b] critical injury.

name: Antidote Set
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce check to resist poison by two (to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b]. Must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Underworld check[b] if poison is unknown.

description: Poisoning is not a common concern for most citizens, but for certain high-value persons of interest, it is an all too real hazard.
details: A character using an antidote set reduces the difficulty of any check to resist a poison by two (to a minimum of Easy (1 Difficulty)). If they do not know which poison was used, they must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Knowledge - Underworld check to make an educated guess at the poison based on the region, the poison's qualities, and other evidence at their disposal to benefit from this item.

name: Cybernetic Arms (Mod V)
reference: Please see page 173 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 182 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Cybernetic Arms (Mod VI)
reference: Please see page 173 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 182 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Cybernetic Brain Implant
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 183 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: These enhancements are miniaturized computer implants designed to augment the user's brainpower.
details: A cybernetic brain implant provides +1 Intellect and includes a comlink and computer access link.

name: Cybernetic Eyes
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 183 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Cybernetic eyes were designed to restore sight to beings who have been blind since birth or have lost their sight due to disease or accident.
details: Users with cybernetic eyes gain +1 Vigilance and Perception.

name: Cybernetic Leg (Mod II)
reference: Please see page 173 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 183 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Cybernetic Leg (Mod III)
reference: Please see page 173 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 189 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 183 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Cyberscanner Limb
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: More than a simple cybernetic replacement, this cybernetic arm includes a basic scanner for medium-range detection.
details: The Mod IV Scanner Limb incorporates a portable scanner (such as the General Purpose Scanner) and, unlike most cybernetics, is concealed by a synthflesh covering to disguise that there is anything out of the ordinary about the limb.

name: Immune Implant
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Given the wide variety of life-forms and the frequency with which many travel the galaxy, it's little wonder that the spread and containment of disease is of major concern to medical professionals and travelers alike.
details: Possessing an immune implant grants the wearer +1 Resilience.

name: Implant Armor
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Favored by infiltrators, spies, and other clandestine operatives, implant armor is useful for occasions where obvious armor protection might be impractical.
details: Implant armor provides +1 soak.

name: Repli-Limb Prosthetic (limb)
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Repli-Limb Prosthetic (organ)
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Cybernetic Weapon Implant
reference: Please see page 174 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Contains a built-in retractable light blaster pistol

description: Popular among bounty hunters, assassins, and clandestine operatives, cybernetic weapon implants guarantee that no matter the situation, an individual is never without a weapon.
details: A basic cybernetic weapon arm appears to be a regular cybernetic arm but features a retractable Light Blaster Pistol that can be deployed as an incidental. The blaster is attached to the arm and cannot be removed, dropped, or disarmed.

name: CAAF-2 Avionics Interface
reference: Please see page 101 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: +1 rank Piloting - Planetary when piloting airspeeders (Must have at least 1 rank in Piloting - Planetary)

name: Repulsor Fist
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Counts as a Brawl weapon

description: Also called a repulse–hand or a enforcer grip, this durasteel weapon cybernetic is typically neither covered in synthskin nor intendeded to appear natural.
details: A repulsor fist provides one rank of the Defensive Stance talent and counts as a Brawl weapon with a damage of 8, a critical rating of 3, and the Concussive 1 and Slow-Firing 2 qualities. While a character may still make Brawl attacks when this weapon is "recharging" due to the Slow-Firing quality, they do so without any benefits from the weapon—they simply make an unarmed Brawl attack.

name: Adrenal Implant
reference: Please see page 106 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: A small implant affixed to the suprarenal glands, an adrenal implant stimulates the production of epinephrine in the body when the individual's nervous system is subjected to strain.
details: An adrenal implant provides one rank of the Rapid Recovery talent.

name: Cybernetic Reflexes
reference: Please see page 106 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: A series of specialized implants designed to stimulate and help regulate the sympathetic nervous system of the user, cybernetic reflexes can greatly increase an individual's reaction time to outside stimuli and threats.
details: Cybernetic reflexes provide one rank of Rapid Reaction talent.

name: Cybernetic Respirator
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Provides benefits of breath mask and respirator.

description: For those organics seeking to escape fleshy frailties, cybernetic respirators offer an alternative to lungs.
details: A cybernetic respirator permanently provides a character with the benefits of a Breath Mask/Respirator and one rank of the Blooded talent.

name: Gank Comm Implant
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: This peculiar comlink implant interfaces directly with the user's neocortex, allowing the user to communicate silently with other characters who possess similar implants merely by thinking.
details: Characters with Gank comm implants can communicate silently with each other at ranges of up to several kilometers. Since these implants do not use audible information exchange, they cannot be used to communicate with a normal comlink. Likewise, due to the unique nature of these devices, it is virtually impossible for anyone without the implant to listen in on others' comm implant communications, though comm jammers can disrupt their signals. The messages sent via Gank comm implants are not auditory, so effectively communicating requires the users to share a language.

name: Implanted Cyberjack
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of Computers check to disable security or slice a computer by one.

description: Usually taking the form of a prosthetic finger or other artificial appendage, a cyberjack allows its use to directly interface with a computer system via  a universal serial socket.
details: Once per check, a character with an implanted cyberjack may suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of a Computers check to disable a security device or slice into a computer system by one.

name: Neuromachine Interface
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When piloting vehicle with linked control device, may use Coordination skill instead of Piloting skill.

description: A vehicle control system designed to be integrated directly into the nervous system, this ingenious (if notoriously difficult to use) device allows the user to control a vehicle with a thought, moving it as if it were part of their own body.
details: When piloting a vehicle with the linked control device, a character with a neuromachine interface may use Coordination in place of the Piloting - Planetary or Piloting - Space skill.

name: Q-22 Retinal Tracker
reference: Please see page 107 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Provides [ADVANTAGE] on Gunnery and Ranged-Heavy checks.

description: Consisting of microsensors implanted directly behind the user's retina and a tiny tracking computer installed at the base of the skull, a retinal tracker aids the user in targeting imminent threats.
details: A retinal tracker provides an automatic Advantage result on a character's Gunnery and Ranged - Heavy checks.

name: Cyborg/Droid Interface
reference: Please see page 112 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Allows access to hidden information in a droid's memory banks when linked.
When attempting to access information that a linked droid does not want revealed, Computer checks may be upgraded once.

description: Neuro-Saav's cyborg/droid interface is a supplementary cybernetic that must be used in conjunction with a Cybernetic Brain Implant.
details: Not only does this device let a cyborg access hidden information stored in a droid's memory banks, but it also allows it, when attempting to access information that a hostile droid does not wish to reveal, to upgrade the ability of all its Computers checks once.

name: Swift 78B Vessel Courier System
reference: Please see page 112 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The Swift 78B vessel courier system is a discreet, cybernetically implanted data storage device.
details: Because the vessel courier system is independent of the courier, the data within it cannot be accessed or modified by them.

name: Biofeedback Regulator
reference: Please see page 49 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Cannot be installed on droids.
May only install a single biofeedback regulator.

description: Unusual for cybernetic implants, a biofeedback regulator achieves nothing for the recipient when installed on its own.
details: A biofeedback regulator increases the character's cybernetic implant cap by two. It does not itself count toward the character's cybernetic implant cap. Biofeedback regulators cannot be installed on droids, and a character can only have a single biofeedback regulator installed.

name: Escape Circuit
reference: Please see page 49 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can only be installed on droids.
Can resist restraining bolts with an [B]Easy ([DI]) Discipline check[b]  May spend [AD][AD] to overload restraining bolt, rendering it useless.

description: Many free droids find the notion of being placed back into servitude intolerable.
details: An escape circuit is a cybernetic implant that can only be installed in droids. A droid installed with an escape circuit can resist a Restraining Bolt with an Easy (1 Difficulty) Discipline check instead of the normal difficulty. The droid may spend two Advantage results from a check made to resist a restraining bolt to overload the bolt, rendering it entirely useless.

name: Networked Slicing Uplink
reference: Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can only be installed on droids.
Counts as having slicer gear.
When droid is slicing or assisting in slicing, add [SE] to [B]Computers checks[b] to identify slicer (e.g., the Trace User action).

description: Some slicers make use of a rare and highly illegal set of droid modifications to mask their slicing signatures by routing them through a droid's systems, which fill the signature with junk data from the droid's base-level processes.
details: A networked slicing uplink is a cybernetic implant that can only be installed in droids. In addition to its other effects, it counts as a set of Slicer Gear. When the droid is slicing or assisting with slicing tasks, add a Black Setback die to other characters' Computers checks to identify the slicer based on these activities.

name: Neural Recorder
reference: Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Discipline check[b] to recall any information experienced while recorder was running.
Can copy recordings to common types of external storage devices.

description: An individual with a neural recorder installed gains the ability to record and store sensory information with the veracity and recall of and advanced computer system.
details: A neural recorder allows the user to make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Discipline check to recall any information experienced while the recorder was running. This information is highly detailed and generally comparable in quality to a holorecording. The installation of a neural recorder usually includes a small connection port on the palm. A character with a neural recorder can copy information it records to an external storage device using this connection.

name: Surge Override Switch
reference: Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Once per encounter as an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Discipline check[b].  If successful, may reactivate any overloaded cybernetic implants, such as from the Ion quality or similar effects, by suffering 2 strain per overloaded implant reactivated.
Cannot be overloaded by the Ion quality or similar effects.

description: Ion weapons, electrical phenomena, and overloads are a danger to anyone who relies too heavily on cybernetics.
details: Once per encounter as an action, a character with a surge override switch may make an Average (3 Difficulty) Discipline check. If they succeed, they may reactivate any number of cybernetic implants that have been overloaded by weapons with the Ion quality, the Overcharge talent talent, or similar effects. For each implant they reactivate this way, they suffer 2 strain. A surge override switch cannot be disabled by Ion weapons or overloaded by other means.

name: Electrobinoculars
reference: Please see page 175 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: User may see in low light or extreme bright light conditions.
Magnifies targetets up to 10 kilometers away.
User may remove [SE] imposed due to long range or low light.

description: Electrobinoculars are, at their most basic, a pair of macrobinoculars with one or more integrated optical enhancement systems, such as long-range digital zoom, passive light amplification, thermal imaging, ultrasound imaging, and the like.
details: Electrobinoculars allow their user to see normally in low light, extremely bright conditions, and inclement conditions. They also provide magnification of targets up to ten kilometers away. When using electrobinoculars, characters may remove a Black Setback die from any Perception checks made to identify an object in low light or at long distances.

name: General Purpose Scanner
reference: Please see page 175 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: General purpose scanners are usually small, handheld devices designed to sense and record a variety of data.

name: Hand Scanner
reference: Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The term "hand scanner" is a catchall designation used to describe a variety of handheld scanning devices used for specialized purposes.
details: While this device provides no specific bonuses, it may allow character to uncover information related to its focus, at the GM's discretion.

name: Macrobinoculars
reference: Please see page 175 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Simpler, less expensive, and often more reliable than electrobinoculars, macrobinoculars are a common sight throughout the galaxy.

name: Scanner Goggles
reference: Please see page 175 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Scanner goggles are a lighter, wearable version of electrobinoculars equipped with a more limited set of optical enhancements.

name: Protective Goggles
reference: These goggles protect the wearer from the effects of       bright light.  They can negate negative consequences of      light and can prevent blindness in very bright conditions.      Defels wear them due to their high sensitivity to      visible light.  When worn by a Defel, it eliminates their      light sensitivity trait.

name: Surveillance Tagger
reference: Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Tiny and unobtrusive, surveillance taggers are small radio transmitting beacons used to aid in surveillance and tracking.

name: Long Range Terrain Scanner
reference: Please see page 47 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Ground-Penetrating Sensor Pack
reference: Please see page 47 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This sensor array is mostly used by archeologists or even scavengers, as it analyses the ground beneath it to determine composition - bringing out artificial structures from basic ground composition.

name: ILF-6500 Life Form Scanner
reference: Please see page 47 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Hunting Goggles
reference: Please see page 48 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to any Perception check made to locate prey
Removes up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to concealment, darkness or fog, and mist from all Ranged-Light and Ranged-Heavy checks

description: Hunting goggles are a type of scanner goggles specifically designed to assist professional guides an hunters in tracking their quarry.
details: Hunting goggles grant a Blue Boost die to any Perception checks made to locate prey, and thanks to their image magnification and enhancement, they remove up to two Black Setback dice imposed due to concealment, darkness, fog, or mist from all Ranged - Light and Ranged - Heavy checks.

name: HSI-280 Hyperwave Signal Interceptor
reference: Please see page 101 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Weapon Detection Goggles
reference: Please see page 101 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Up to [BOOST][BOOST] to Perception checks to find concealed weapon

description: A weapon detector is a specialized sensor built into goggles that is able to detect the presence of explosives, the power cells used in blasters, and the chemical propellants used in slugthrowers, as well as many types of melee weapons, such as knives, swords, and stun batons.
details: A character using weapon detection goggles may add up to two Blue Boost dice to Perception checks when attempting to find a concealed weapon on a person.

name: Mark 6  Combat Scanner
reference: Please see page 56 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can see normally in dark, track motion, heat, and metal, and adds [SETBACK][SETBACK] to attempts to decode transmissions to/from combat scanners.

name: Mark 10 Demolitions Scanner
reference: Please see page 57 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST] to attempts to detect explosive devices.

description: This unit is handheld, designed to detect a suite of chemical and energy signatures of most explosive constructs. It can be used independently or connected to an interface.

name: PX-7 Heat Sensor
reference: Please see page 50 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to Perception checks to find heat-emitting objects within short range.
Add [BO] to Mechanics checks to remove Critical Hits from starships and Critical Injuries from droids.

description: The ChandrilTech PX-7 heat sensor used to detect anomalous variations in temperature nearby.
details: A PX-7 heat sensor adds two Blue Boost dice to Perception checks to find heat-emitting objects within short range and adds a Blue Boost die to Mechanics checks to remove Critical Hits from starships and Critical Injuries from droids.

name: Veridicator 200
reference: Please see page 51 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to checks to discern whether another character is lying or omitting significant information.
Add [BO][BO] to checks to ascertain another character's mental state.

description: Designed and distributed by Saldalith Manufacturing, the Veridicator is billed as a personal lie-detection device.
details: [...] Only one target can be scanned and monitored at a time, and they must be relatively nearby. Both the user and the target must remain relatively still, though small movements are unlikely to affect the device's readings. A character wearing a Veridicator 200 adds two Blue Boost dice to checks to discern whether another character is lying or omitting significant information and adds two Blue Boost dice to checks to ascertain another character's mental state.

reference: Please see page 110 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: +1 Brawn until end of encounter.  Upgrades difficulty of Agility-, Intellect-, and Cunning-related skills until end of session.

reference: Please see page 110 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: +1 Brawn until end of encounter.  Upgrades difficulty of Agility-, Intellect-, and Cunning-related skills until end of session.

reference: Please see page 111 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [AD][AD] for Agility- and Willpower-related checks until end of encounter. After, suffer [THREAT] to Brawn-. Intellect-. and Cunning-related checks until end of session.

name: Frangawl Force Powder (1 dose)
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character can consume a dose as a maneuver.  The PC gains 10 Conflict and adds [DA][DA] to his next Force power check during that encounter.

name: Longsight (1 dose)
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May be injected as a maneuver, increasing Willpower by 1 until the end of the encounter.  Suffer 2 strain at the beginning of each subsequent turn.

reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook, or page 55 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook, for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Devaronian may inhale one dose as a maneuver, suffering 2 strain and adding [BO] to all Brawn and Agility checks until the end of the encounter.

name: Bacta (liter)
reference: Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 192 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

reference: Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 192 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
