name: Portable Healing Kit
reference: Please see page 129 of the Force and Destiny Beta Rulebook for details.

name: Emergency Medpac
reference: Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 192 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Emergency medpacs are prevalent wherever the threat of injury is higher than average.
details: Emergency medpacs allow characters to use the Medicine skill to heal others without penalty.

name: Medpac
reference: Please see page 177 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 192 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to all Medicine skill checks

description: This medpac is used by military personnel in the field, carried by those without training. It contains a datapad with instructions and a database of good-to-know information.

name: Physician's Kit
reference: Please see page 186 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to all Medicine skill checks, and [ADVANTAGE] to successful Medicine checks.

description: These kits are a more extensive medpac, used by medical personnel for all sorts of medical procedures. It is well equipped, but heavier.

name: Stimpack
reference: Please see page 177 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 193 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 186 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Heals 5 wounds.

description: Stimpacks are auto-injection tubes filled with medicine, bacta, and painkillers.
details: A stimpack requires one maneuver to administer it to oneself or an engaged target. This immediately heals 5 wounds. While a character can use multiple stimpacks, doing so is an act of diminishing returns, as every stimpack used after the first heals one fewer wound. A second stimpack heals 4 wounds, a third 3 wounds, and so on. Using a sixth stimpack in a single day has no further effect, as the character's system is already so saturated with medications that additional stimpacks are useless (and could even cause harm, at the GM's discretion). Once used, the chemicals within a stimpack stay in a character's system for one standard day, after which additional stimpacks have their full effect again.

name: Synthskin
reference: Please see page 177 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 193 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 186 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Synthskin and synthflesh are two versions of a synthetic, skin-like covering used in medicine and the production of cybernetic limbs.
details: Synthskin applications are one-use items that can be used as first aid to treat cuts and bruises.

name: ECM-598 Medical Backpack
reference: Please see page 48 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to all Medicine skill checks while using the ECM-598.
Decrease the difficulty of Medicine checks to heal Critical Injuries by 1 to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b].

description: This medpack is produced for military and field-rescue groups, containing anything one would need for an emergency. It also contains a set of tutorials and instructions for dealing with emergency situations.

name: Syntherope
reference: Please see page 49 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: FlashFire Camp Stove
reference: Please see page 47 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: SEI's FlashFire is a compact, lightweight, all-in-one camp stove designed for individuals who need to travel light through the wilderness.

name: "Survivalist" Mess Kit
reference: Please see page 47 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: The Survivalist by SEI is one of the most popular compact mess kits in the galaxy.

name: Water Purifier
reference: Please see page 48 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: Water purifiers are made by countless wilderness supply and outfitting companies throughout the galaxy.
details: [...] In ten minutes, a typical purifier can treat enough water to fulfil one sentient's needed for one day of rigorous activity.

name: IRAPS Cerebral Stabilizer
reference: Please see page 57 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Military Medpac
reference: Please see page 57 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Counts as having 1 rank in Medicine if user has none.

description: This medpac is used by military personnel in the field, carried by those without training. It contains a datapad with instructions and a database of good-to-know information.

name: XV-38 Veterinary Kit
reference: Please see page 44 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST] to all Medicine, Survival, and Xenology skill checks made to analyze or treat large beasts.

name: XV-09 Chemical Restraint Harness
reference: Please see page 44 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Pacified beasts gain [BOOST] to any [B]Displine Checks[b].

description: This chemical pacifier is typically used by those who do not care for the animals they have in their possession. The harness keeps the pacifier out of the creature's reach which injects the beast and keeps it docile.

name: Blood Scanner
reference: Please see page 51 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, make [B]Easy ([DI]) Medicine check[b] to identify foreign elements (including poisons) in blood samples. Adds [AD][AD] to next Medicine check to treat patient.

description: Utilized for medical diagnostics, blood scanners are sensitive devices capable of scanning blood samples from nearly any species.
details: As an action, a character with a blood scanner may make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Medicine check to identify foreign elements (including poisons) in a blood sample. In addition to allowing the character to treat any present toxins with the proper antidote, the extensive information about the patient's health adds two automatic Advantage results to the next Medicine check the character makes to treat the patient.

name: Med-Aid Patch
reference: Please see page 51 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Expend 1 med-aid patch to add automatic [SU][AD] to Medicine check to heal wounds.

description: "Med–aid" is a general term applied to single-use bandages and compresses that have been infused with bacta, antibiotics, coagulants, and other healing agents.
details: When making a Medicine check to heal wounds from a character, a character can expend up to one med-aid patch to add an automatic Success and Advantage result to the results of the check. A character cannot use more than one med-aid patch per check.

name: Dejarik Table
reference: Please see page 182 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Dejarik uses a holographic display to project playing pieces representing existing fauna of the galaxy. It is a skill based game where the 2 players battle it out using strategy.

name: Sabacc Deck
reference: Please see page 182 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: A marked deck makes the act of cheating in Sabacc much easier, when it would previously be virutally impossible. Hustlers and scoundrels typically play with a personal deck to tip the odds to their favour.

name: Marked Sabacc Deck
reference: Please see page 108 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gain [BOOST] to Deception checks when gambling.

description: A marked deck makes the act of cheating in Sabacc much easier, when it would previously be virutally impossible. Hustlers and scoundrels typically play with a personal deck to tip the odds to their favour.

name: Loaded Chance Cube
reference: Please see page 108 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gain [BOOST][BOOST] to Deception checks when gambling.

description: These extremely simple gambling tools are unfortunately a source of great riches and losses, and weighting a pair is extremely easy. However, getting away with cheating the cubes becomes quite difficult when rolling in front of the same person multiple times.

name: Binders
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 193 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 187 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Designed to restrain the particularly slippery individuals, grav-binders use microrepulsor technology to artificially apply the effects of extreme gravity to a captive.
details: Breaking free from grav-binders requires a Formidable (5 Difficulty) Athletics check (due to the restrictive effects of the artificially raised gravity on the whole body, a character cannot slip free of grav-binders using flexibility alone).

name: Comm Jammer
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 194 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Where there are people wishing to communicate, there are people wishing to prevent it, and thus there are jammers.
details: Cutting through the noise created by a comm jammer requires a Computers check, with a difficulty proportional to the distance from the jammer and power of the device. The closer and more powerful the jammer, the harder the difficulty. The "Hail" forces a Standard (2 Difficulty) check, which becomes more difficult at close ranges (the exact difficulty is up to the GM, but should increase to Hard (3 Difficulty) or Daunting (4 Difficulty) if at medium range or closer to the device).

name: Comm Scrambler
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 194 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The success and survival of an operation often hinges on preventing the enemy from listening in on friendly comm traffic.
details: Using a comm scrambler adds two Black Setback dice to any checks made to decode an encrypted transmission.

name: Disguise Kit
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 194 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 187 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Disguise kits are simple collections of makeup, wigs, hairpieces, prosthetic features, and chromatic iris alternators; some even contain programmable skinweave for altering fingerprints and DNA cloaks that spoof advanced genetic scanners.

name: Electronic Lock Breaker
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 194 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 187 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Whether stealing rare treasures from a private collector or museum, or securing arms or medical equipment from military bases for an armed resistance, operatives and thieves often need to overcome physical security systems.

name: Restraining Bolt
reference: Please see page 178 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 194 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 187 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The "Knack" appears as a normal restraining bolt, but contains protocols capable of implanting secret programs and orders into the droid.

name: Slicer Gear
reference: Please see page 179 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 195 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Slicers, talented computer jockeys who navigate the labyrinthine guts of computer code and mainframe systems as easily as an ace pilot navigates through an asteroid belt, use specially constructed gear to gain access to secure computer systems.

name: MC-100 Magnacuffs
reference: Please see page 46 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Forensics Investigation Kit
reference: Please see page 46 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds automatic [SUCCESS] to all Perception checks made by the user to spot and gather evidence.

description: Essentially specialized tool kits for crime-scene investigations, forensic investigation kits are produced by a number of security companies for use by law enforcement agencies.
details: When used during the investigation of a crime, a forensic investigation kit adds an automatic Success result to all Perception checks made by the user to spot and gather evidence. It may also count as the "right tools for the job" when making checks to analyze evidence gathered. At the Game Master's discretion, this item can also be used for related purposes such as archaeological digs.

name: Thalassian Security Collar
reference: Please see page 108 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removing requires [B]Daunting ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Skulduggery check[b].  Failure causes 2 strain, 1 wound, and disorients for 5 rounds.

name: Explosive Shackles
reference: Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removing requires [B]Daunting ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Skulduggery check[b].  Failure causes 10 wound to each character in engaged range.

description: A particularly intimidating and malicious method of security slaves and prisoners, explosive shackles have small but lethal charges built into them to deter escape attempts.
details: Removing explosive shackles without the proper key requires a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Skulduggery check. If a character fails this check, the shackles detonate, inflicting 10 wounds on the wearer and each character in engaged range (this ignores soak).

name: Authentication Tools
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to checks to determine if documents are falsified.

description: As criminals and spies advance their ability to forge documents, the need to detect falsifications becomes paramount.
details: A character using authentication tools adds two Blue Boost dice to checks to determine if a document has been falsified.

name: Concealed Recorder
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to find a concealed recorder on a person's body.

description: A surreptitiously captured moment can be turned into evidence that wins wars, topples governments, or simply persuades a certain person to remain silent.
details: Add two Black Setback dice to a character's Perception checks to find a concealed recorder on a person's body.

name: Data Dead Drop
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something hidden by a data dead drop.

description: As simple as a datachip hidden in a commonplace item, this piece of equipment allows a covert exchange of information with the security that if intercepted, the information will be safe.

name: Diplomatic Authorization
reference: Please see page 51 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants automatic [AD][AD] to all social checks involving foreign governments and access to individuals and services in those governments.

description: Government agenst who travel to neutral, allied, or even hostile star systems can reasonably expect to receive special treatment.
details: A character with diplomatic authorization adds two automatic Advantage results to social skill checks involving members of a planetary of system government, and they can often get access to individuals and services within that government that would otherwise be unavailable. Unless lawfully granted by an authorized body, however, this item can only be acquired illegally.

name: Falsified Credentials
reference: Please see page 51 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Requires [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] or [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to discover credentials are fakes.

description: Whether for relatively tame reasons such as traveling incognito, or more nefarious reasons such as government infiltration, the demand for fake credentials has remained strong.
details: False credentials can fool most cursory examinations, and characters using scanners require a successful Hard (3 Difficulty) Computers to recognize the credentials as fakes. Attempting to detect fake credentials without appropriate equipment requires a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Perception check.

name: Forgery Tools
reference: Please see page 51 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: Regardless of the case or the legitimacy of the reason, quality forgery tools such as carefully crafted inks and implements or complex credential-falsification devices can enhance a crafter's innate talents.

name: "Knack" Restraining Bolt
reference: Please see page 52 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: The "Knack" appears as a normal restraining bolt, but contains protocols capable of implanting secret programs and orders into the droid.

name: Poisoner's Ring
reference: Please see page 52 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May contain a single dose of poison or other substance.
Can make a [B]Skulduggery vs. Vigilance check[b] to deposit contents into a meal or beverage without being noticed.

description: Produced by a wide variety of artisans, poisoners' rings and similar accessories look like the sort of elegant jewelry commonly worn by aristocrats and wealthy folk.
details: A poisoner's ring can hold a single dose of any :Drugs & Poisons. As an action, a character wearing the ring may make an opposed Skulduggery check vs. Vigilance against any onlookers to deposit the contents into a target's meal or beverage without being noticed.

name: Security Sweeper
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to discover presence and location of recording or espionage devices within medium range.
If recording or espionage device is hidden, make [B]Computers vs. Mechanics check[b] against the Mechanics skill of the hider.

description: Government officials and military personnel must maintain a vigilant guard against espionage, taking great pains to ensure they are not overheard or recorded.
details: A character using a security sweeper may check an area for espionage tools by making an Average (3 Difficulty) Computers. If they succeed, the device notifies them of the presence and location of any recording or espionage devices within medium range of their current location. If the device is particularly well hidden, this check might be opposed by the Mechanics skill of the character who placed the device.

name: Sound Dampener
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] to checks to detect noise within short range of the sound dampener.

description: Using technology originally designed to minimize the constant background noise of a crowded metropolis, Veslox Corporation ingeniously realized the effect could be localized, and its sound dampener quickly became a best-seller in the criminal underworld.
details: The spherical dampening field extends to short range around the device; characters add two Black Setback dice to checks detect noise coming out of the area inside the field.

name: AL-DR8 Grav-Binders
reference: Please see page 51 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Breaking free requires a [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Athletics check[b].

name: Personal Transponder
reference: Please see page 51 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Finding exact location within close planetary range requires an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b]. Increase difficulty by two for each additional range band, up to extreme.

description: Personal transponders are low-powered tracking devices used to locate individuals.
details: Picking up a personal transponder's signal accurately enough to find its exact location within close range on planetary scale requires an Average (3 Difficulty) Computers. Increase the difficulty of this check by two for each planetary scale range band beyond close, to a maximum of extreme range at the planetary scale.

name: Stun Cuffs
reference: Please see page 52 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Breaking free requires a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Athletics[b] or [B]Coordination check[b].  [TH][TH] or [DE] suffers 4 strain, ignoring soak.

name: Crash Survival Kit
reference: Please see page 180 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 195 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Popular among pilots and vehicle crews, crash survival kits are a necessary precaution for those who regularly travel through inhospitable areas.
details: Most survival kits include a thermal coat, a multitool or Explorer's Knife, a Saladar Systems PED-21 Distress Beacon, two emergency Comlink, a spool of wire, ration bars, a basic medpac, two Breath Mask and Respirators, a water jug with filter, a Glow Rod, fifty meters of Degan Explorations Synthrope, ten Field Ration Packs, and an emergency Luma Flare. Military pilots, smugglers, and bounty hunters often include a Holdout Blaster as well.

name: Ration Pack
reference: Please see page 179 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Food from rations is generally tasteless and bland, providing enough food for a single meal.

name: Breath Mask
reference: Please see page 179 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 195 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Designed to allow sentient beings to breathe in dangerous atomspheres, respirators and breath masks are some of the most common pieces of survival gear in existence.

name: Space Suit
reference: Please see page 179 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Wilderness Survival Kit
reference: Please see page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
description: These kits are an essential for those travelling through inhospitable areas regularly.

name: Tent
reference: Please see page 180 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Alliance standard issue, this triangular two-meter tent inflates and anchors in minutes, and sleeps up to four.
details: Sleeping in a plastent removes two Black Setback dice from the user's checks to resist hostile temperatures while sleeping, and downgrades the difficulty of any such checks once.

name: Thermal Cloak
reference: Please see page 180 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] from any checks made to handle extreme heat or cold.

description: Thermal cloaks are versatile pieces of equipment that can be worn or used as a blanket and provide protection from extreme heat and cold.
details: Use of a thermal blanket or cloak removes up to two Black Setback dice from checks made to handle extreme heat or cold.

name: Electro-Snare
reference: Please see page 49 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This snare is used by hunters and explorers of the outer rim to somewhat passively catch animals in the wild.

name: Portable Survival Shelter
reference: Please see page 49 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This is a collapsible one-person tent, made of flexible and durable fabrics which allow it to be easily portable, collapsing into the size of a large datapad. It has a water-reclamation system and can resist both fire and lightning.

name: Electric Perimeter Fence
reference: Please see page 49 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This fence is a set of posts hooked up to a generator which is often hidden or left protected. The system produces a field which stuns targets which come into contact with it.

name: PED-21 Personal Distress Beacon
reference: Please see page 50 of Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Searchers gain [BOOST][BOOST] to any Perception, Computers, or Surveillance checks made in the course of the search

name: Field Kitchen
reference: Please see page 50 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST][BOOST] to any Survival or Education skill checks made to store, identify, cook, or sterilize comestibles

description: The field kitchen is, as the name indicates, a fully equipped kitchen that has been made collapsible and transportable by the most dedicated explorers who simply cannot do without a civilised meal.

name: Viscera Field Dressing Kit
reference: Please see page 51 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to any Survival skill checks made to harvest meat, organs, or bones from a prey animal

description: This kit contains a variety of knives, hooks and shears which are all useful for shredding game into usable parts. It is used by survivalists and hunting enthusiasts in the fringe.

name: Scout 5 Field Goggles
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: These goggles are a simple set of gear that simply protects a soldier's eyes from debris, built to be durable and comfortable.

name: Field Rations
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: These rations differ from standard ones due to their awful taste and hyper infusion of nutrients to last a soldier 1 week.

name: Fire Paste
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: This versatile chemical putty is used to ignite and sustain emergency fires.
details: Corellian Chemical Corporation's fire paste can be used to ignite nearly any flammable object. Without a fuel source, it can burn for roughly an hour with the same intensity as a small campfire. It can burn in any atmosphere, but not underwater or in vacuum.

name: Food Preparation System
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: This dubiously named field stove, more commonly known to military personnel as a "hot plate," is little more than a collapsible tray with integrated circuitry for preparing field rations and other food products.

name: Tauntaun Pup Tent
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: This tent is easy to transport and collapse, but when deployed is especially useful in hostile environments. The weave is made of insulating materials, resisting freezing temperatures.

name: CN-15 Camouflage Netting (Roll)
reference: Please see page 57 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [FAILURE][FAILURE] to all checks made to detect items hidden by netting.

name: CN-21 Camouflage Paint
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [FAILURE] to all checks made to detect items hidden by paint.

description: This thick paint comes in small tubes, used to camouflage exposed skin or weaponry - anything that is small enough to cover effectively. The paint contains photoreactive pigments which match its surroundings.

name: Canteen
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: This contained is built from synthetics and housed in a canvas cover available in a variety of colours and patterns.

name: CX-2000 Holographic Ghillie Suit
reference: Please see page 58 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Increases difficulty to detect wearer by 1 if immobile.

name: Biome Generator
reference: Please see page 46 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: This popular product from Tri-Planetary Atmospherics is capable of producing any biome in the universe, following even the most stringent biological requirements. It is generally integrated into existing ventilation and temperature regulation systems.

name: GX-8 Water Vaporator
reference: Please see page 47 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: This is one of the most popular moisture vaporators on the market, capable of providing fresh and safe water to pioneers on the fringe and on arid planetary systems. It rapidly cools the air and collects the condensation which this creates.

name: Elysium Atmospheric Processor
reference: Please see page 46 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: FasClean Atmospheric Reactive Damper
reference: Please see page 47 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: This equipment is often found on heavily industrialised planets, used to scrub the environment of pollutants and elements that may cause issues to the population or ecosystems of a planet. However, it is also used in tandem with terraforming technology and volcanic planets.

name: A99 Aquata Breather
reference: Please see page 52 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: The aquata breather is a portable device consisting of two small tanks connected to a mouthpiece.
details: It supplies up to two hours of breathable air, and is particularly suited to subaquatic environments. Aquata breathers are designed to be disposable. Once the two-hour air supply is depleted, the unit cannot be recharged.

name: InstaMist Generator
reference: Please see page 52 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, may activate to fill an area out to short range with heavy fog.  Fog lasts for three rounds (see page 219 of the [B]Force and Destiny[b] Core Rulebook for details on fog).

description: Though designed for firefighting and agricultural use, Agrierd Intergalactics' InstaMist generator has found a place in the arsenals of some combatants who use it to create ambushes or make quick escapes.
details: As an action, a character may activate an InstaMist generator to fills an area out to short range of the generator with a heavy fog. Heavy fog adds three Black Setback dice to Ranged - Light, Ranged - Heavy, Gunnery, and Perception checks against targets obscured by it, and adds three Blue Boost dice to Stealth checks made by characters concealed by it. The heavy fog lasts for three rounds. At the GM's discretion, windy conditions can cause it to become concealed by it. The heavy fog lasts for three rounds. At the GM's discretion, windy conditions can cause it to become fog or mist or reduce the time it takes for the vapor to disperse entirely. The generator comes with five vapor cartridges. Additional vapor cartridges cost 10 credits each, and other cartridges vary in price based on their function.

name: Jedi Utility Belt
reference: Please see page 52 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Designed long ago by skilled artisans, the Jedi utility belt has become common gear for many Knights operating in the field.
details: A Jedi utility belt contains a three-day supply of food capsules, an Emergency Medpac, a Lightsaber Maintenance Kit, a slim Glow Rod, a comlink, and an A99 Aquata Breather. A number of empty pouches are concealed along the belt's interior side, allowing the wearer to hide small items. In addition, a standard lightsaber can be securely hung from the belt for easy access. A Jedi utility belt also increases the wearer's encumbrance threshold by 1.

name: Luma Flare
reference: Please see page 52 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Gunnery check[b] to launch flare into air to provide light. Success illuminates out to long range.  Failure illuminates ground to short range.

description: Luma flares are rocket-propelled illumination devices commonly used by both militaries and survivalists.
details: As an action, a character may make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Gunnery check to launch a luma flare into the air to provide light. If they succeed and the flare has room to travel into the air, the flare completely illuminated an area out to long range from the location it was fired. If [they] fail or do not have room to fire it, the flare still ignites, but it but does not travel into the air. Instead, it remains at ground level, illuminating an area out to short range. Whether [they] succeed or fail, the flare's illumination continues for five rounds, after which time it burns out. Though luma flares are not designed as weapons, creative characters can nonetheless use them as such. They are extremely hard to aim, but the mere prospect of being struck by one will cause many foes to reconsider attacking. They have the following profile as a weapon: luma flare (Gunnery; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range-Long; Blast 4, Burn 4, Disorient 2, Inaccurate 2, Prepare 2, Limited Ammo 1).

name: Backpack
reference: Please see page 180 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 198 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Most backpacks are simple textile constructs with a number of compartments and external pouches good for just about anything.
details: Backpacks increase the wearer's encumbrance threshold by four.

name: Climbing Gear
reference: Please see page 180 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 188 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Climbing gear comprises tools used to scale steep or sheer surfaces.

name: Datapad
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 196 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: A powerful combination of communications device, holo-messenger, handheld computer, and personal database, datapads combine a number of common electronics in one easy to use package.

name: Emergency Repair Patch
reference: Please see page 182 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 50 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Repairs 3 wounds on a droid.

description: Composed of a semi-flexible durasteel disk coated on one side with insulation and edged with auto-activating thermal welds, emergency repair patches are used to keep machinery running until proper repairs can be done.
details: Emergency repair patches are one use items that grant the normal bonus [of being The Right Tool for the Job]. Likewise, droids can use them to heal wounds in a manner similar to the way an organic being employs a stimpack. Using an emergency repair patch requires a character to spend a maneuver. When applied to droids, emergency repair patches heal 3 wounds, and up to five patches can be used in a single day. Using a sixth emergency repair patch has no effect; by that point, the droid is so patched and jury-rigged together that further patches would be useless. It takes one day for a droid's self-repair routines, or actual repairs, to restore its body to enough functionality to be able to gain benefit from additional emergency repair patches.

name: Extra Reload
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: All weapons run out of ammunition at some point, such as gas for energy weapons and kinetic reloads.

name: Extra Reload (Model 38 Detonator Rounds)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Extra Reloads (Model 77 SmartTranq Rounds)
reference: Please see page 40 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Explosive Tipped Arrow (Corellian Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 97 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Stun Arrow (Corellian Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 97 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Extra Reloads (Model 57 Detonator Rounds)
reference: Please see page 42 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Broadhead Arrow (FS19 Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Explosive Tipped Arrow (FS19 Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Incendiary Arrow (FS19 Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Net Arrow (FS19 Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Stun Arrow (FS19 Compound Bow)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Fusion Lantern
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Fusion lanterns are a combination power source, light, and area heater.

name: Glow Rod
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Glow rods are small, directional, handheld light sources used in many applications.

name: Jet Pack
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Jetpacks are ideal when you want a form of transport without using an entire vehicle or speeder. It also has the added benefit of allowing one to reach higher grounds in an extended 'leap'.

name: Tool Kit
reference: Please see page 181 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 198 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: For every job there is a proper tool, and the bigger the job, the more tools a technician needs.
details: Using a custom tool kit grants the user for whom it was built a Blue Boost die to any skill check made to maintain or repair an item, computer, weapon, vehicle, or starship. A character attempting to use custom tools made for someone else suffers a Black Setback die to the same checks. Custom tools can be customized for another user with extensive, and often expensive, modification.

name: Utility Belt
reference: Please see page 183 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 198 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 189 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Designed long ago by skilled artisans, the Jedi utility belt has become common gear for many Knights operating in the field.
details: A Jedi utility belt contains a three-day supply of food capsules, an Emergency Medpac, a Lightsaber Maintenance Kit, a slim Glow Rod, a comlink, and an A99 Aquata Breather. A number of empty pouches are concealed along the belt's interior side, allowing the wearer to hide small items. In addition, a standard lightsaber can be securely hung from the belt for easy access. A Jedi utility belt also increases the wearer's encumbrance threshold by 1.

name: Military Field Manual
reference: Please see page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

modifiers.misc_desc: Once per scene, may gain [BOOST] to any task at the GM's discretion

description: From comprehensive manuals issued to formal military soldiers to the underground publications used to instruct resistance fighters in guerrilla combat, field manuals can be found wherever troopers are common.
details: Depending on the manual, once per scene, a character may use the information found within to gain a Blue Boost die to any task, at the GM's discretion.

name: Mercantiler Datapad
reference: Please see page 48 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Thunderhead PES
reference: Please see page 48 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Musical Instrument (Common)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Musical Instrument (High Quality)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Musical Instrument (Legendary)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Cultural Etiquette Manual
reference: Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add automatic [AD] to social checks with the manual's culture.

description: Protocol droids are often used to cover one's negotiations with foreign cultures and species, however, the droids may at times be unavailable or culturally offensive. In those situations, maintaining etiquette is still paramount, and these manuals cover that.

name: Insider's Guide
reference: Please see page 52 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gains automatic [AD] on any check to find a specific location or service within the region the guide covers.

description: Avoiding tourist traps on worlds one isn't familiar with can sometimes be difficult. These guides exist for those interested in really discovering the intricacies of foreign worlds.

name: "Rider" Ascension Pistol
reference: Please see page 52 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged Light check[b] to fire grappling hook up to medium range. Action to reel in cord.
[B]Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check[b] to reel in himself and another character.

description: Some individuals like to modify their standard sidearms with grappling hooks, but Merr-Sonn has found a dedicated client base that prefers dedicated devices that require no time to prepare.
details: As an action, a character may make an Standard (3 Difficulty) Ranged - Light check to fire the grappling hook onto an object at up to medium range. As another subsequent action, they may reel in the cord, pulling themselves to the target object (or, if the object is unsecured and lighter than they are, pulling the object to the character). A character using an ascension pistol to pull themself and another character aloft must make an Average (3 Difficulty) Athletics check to avoid losing their grip on either their partner or the gun.

name: Species Database
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to Xenology checks.

description: Every encounter with a new species offers the possibility of biological offense, embarrassment, or even accidental poisoning.
details: A character using a species database adds two Blue Boost dice to Xenology checks.

name: R82 Jump Boots
reference: Please see page 115 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]Uses the Aratech R82 Jump Boots vehicle profile[i]
description: Aratech's R82 jump boots are commonly used for sports and leisure activities, but many intrepid explorers and scouts have also found them useful for exploring less accessible areas on newly located worlds.
details: Jump boots allow the user to function as a silhouette 1, speed 2, handling –1, system strain threshold 3 vehicle that can only operate in atmosphere, has a maximum altitude of thirty-five meters, and requires Piloting - Planetary to operate.

name: Mon Calamari Organic Gill
reference: Please see page 115 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Allows underwater breathing for several weeks.

description: Despite their amphibious nature, the Mon Calamari have long made use of a symbiotic blob to breathe underwater for extended periods of time.
details: When placed over an individual's nose and mouth (or equivalent), the symbiote filters oxygen from the ocean water. Organic gills are capable of lasting for several weeks in the water before they begin to die. Wearing an organic gill prevents speech, but this drawback can be alleviated by the introduction of small, waterproof microphones and earphones into the blob. Most species can wear the organic gill easily, as long as they breathe an atmosphere similar to that of the Mon Calamari. Sullustans, however, have demonstrated an allergic reaction to the gills, which prevents their species from employing them.

name: Verpine Bond Gauntlets
reference: Please see page 115 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO] to checks made to handle volatile materials or perform delicate work.

description: Bond gauntlets are a Verpine invention designed to strengthen and reinforce an individual's forearms, while providing stabilization to hand and arm movements.
details: Due to this additional stability, Verpine bond gauntlets grant their users a Blue Boost die to checks made to handle volatile materials or perform delicate work. Such circumstances should be adjudicated by the GM on a case-by-case basis, and may include Computers and Mechanics checks to make delicate repairs and Skulduggery checks to pick locks or disable traps.

name: Verpine Headband
reference: Please see page 115 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Wearer is not incapacitated by exceeding strain threshold.  Instead, he also suffers one wound and becomes disoriented.

description: When worn, a Verpine headband administers small electric shocks to the sleep centers of the wearer's brain in an attempt to keep the wearer awake for extended periods of time.
details: A character wearing a Verpine headband is not incapacitated by exceeding their strain threshold. Instead, for each point of strain they suffer over their threshold, they also suffer a wound, and for as long as their strain exceeds their threshold, they are disoriented.

name: Jedi Multi-Tool
reference: Please see page 53 of the Keeping the Peace Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds automatic [AD] to build, modify, or repair lightsabers.

name: WJ-880 Blinding Helmet
reference: Please see page 53 of the Keeping the Peace Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [SE][SE][SE] to combat checks and other checks requiring sight.

description: In the days of the former Republic and the Jedi Order, the WJ-990 blinding helmet was a common training aid for a Jedi Padawan, helping the aspirant to learn to sense the Force flowing through all things by cutting out sensory distractions.
details: A character wearing a WJ-880 binding helmet adds three Black Setback dice to Combat checks (and any other checks that rely on sight). At the GM's discretion, training while wearing such a helmet might help a character to develop their perception of the Force that shapes and guides the universe around them.

name: Bardottan Chronoscanner
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Due to their concern for the preservation of antiquities, Bardottan port security often carry chronoscanners, in addition to more typical security gear.

name: Thermal Cutter
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Designed for cold-weather expeditions, the Copora-Tech Thermal Cutter is basically a scaled-down mining beamdrill.
details: A thermal cutter's charge lasts for roughly five minutes of continuous use, and can remove one cubic meter of snow per minute, or dig through 10 centimeters of ice per minute. If plugged into a fusion lantern, it can run indefinitely, otherwise it requires a new battery. Nefarious individuals can also use a thermal cutter as a weapon with the following profile (Melee; Damage 4; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Burn 1, Inaccurate 2).

name: Sporting Macrobinoculars
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE] imposed due to long range or poor light.

description: Sporting macrobinoculars incorporate typical macrobinocular functions with video recording and playback features.
details: Sporting macrobinoculars magnify objects up to five kilometers away, and can record objects viewed. They also remove a BlackSetback die imposed due to long range or poor light.

name: Vergence Starchart
reference: Please see page 106 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: To read a starchart correctly, make a [B]Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Astrogation check[b] with [SE][SE].  A [AD] on the check can be spent to determine if the chart is real.

description: Most starcharts showing the location of legendary vergences are clever (or not so clever) fakes designed to part foolish treasure hunters from their credits.
details: A vergence starchart (if it is real), shows the location of one vergence (chosen by the GM). To read the chart correctly, the character must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Astrogation check with two Black Setback dice. An Advantage result on a check can be spent to determine whether or not the chart is real.

name: Starmapper Handheld NaviComputer
reference: Please see page 49 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BO][BO] to all Astrogation checks.  GM may reduce or eliminate bonus if unit has been out of HoloNet range for an extended period of time.

description: Microaxial LLC is a relatively small technology firm from the Core Worlds region that specializes in navicomputers and navigational aids.
details: Using a Starmapper Handheld Navicomputer grants a character two Blue Boost dice to all Astrogation checks. Game Masters can reduce this to one Blue Boost die or eliminate the bonus altogether if the character using the Starmapper has been out of HoloNet range for an extended period of time.

name: Surveyer's Tools
reference: Please see page 49 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BO] to Perception checks when plotting specific locations on a planet's surface, measuring distances, or creating detailed maps.

name: Weapon Maintenance Kit
reference: Please see page 49 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Provides [BO][BO] to Mechanics checks to repair, maintain, or modify a specific class of weapon, chosen when the kit is purchased.

description: Produced by every major galactic arms manufacturer and many general tool and instrument makers, weapon maintenance kits are essential for keeping portable weapons operating under field conditions.
details: When purchasing one of these kits, the player must specify the kit type (blaster, slugthrower, etc.) Each kit provides two Blue Boost dice to any Mechanics checks made to repair, maintain, or modify a weapon, but only for that specific class of weapon.

name: Wizard Pouch
reference: Please see page 106 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: A wizard's pouch is essentially a bag with a shoulder strap; created for the "mages" of Weik to carry spell components.
details: Wizard pouches increase a character's encumbrance threshold by 1.

name: Load-Bearing Gear
reference: Please see page 198 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.
description: More than a backpack, this is a mesh worn on the body to which are attached multiple pockets and holsters. Typically used by military groups and squads on long-range missions.

name: Surveyor's Bag
reference: Please see page 53 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: These are compact bags which are nevertheless quite roomy, used by explorers as smaller equipment - worn over the shoulder across the body.

name: Spacer's Duffel
reference: Please see page 44 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This bulky bag is commonly seen all over the galaxy, convenient for chucking the few items one needs to take on a trip - but not so much for carrying around for a long period of time.

name: Holo V Audio/Visual Translator
reference: Please see page 54 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BOOST] to any Lore or Intellect checks made to decipher or translate an unknown language

name: Mk. IV Modular Backpack
reference: Please see page 51 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.      [BR][I]Note: To purchase accessory pouches for the modular backpack, select the backpack in your inventory and click the "Attachments" button.  An "attachment" will be available for adding the pouches to the backpack.[i]
description: This backpack is a popular with all sorts of explorers and scouts, as it allows for a customised loudout of load-bearing. The pack can be equipped with additional accessory pouches as needed.

name: Mk. III Modular Backpack
reference: Please see page 46 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.      [P][B]Note:[b] To purchase accessory pouches for the modular backpack, select the backpack in your inventory and click the "Attachments" button.  An "attachment" will be available for adding the pouches to the backpack.
description: Creshaldyne Industries' Mk. III Modular Backpack is a civilian version of its popular Creshaldyne Mk. IV Modular Backpack.
details: The Mk. III modular backpack increases a wearer's encumbrance threshold by 2, plus an additional point of encumbrance threshold for each accessory pouch added to the backpack (to a maximum increase of 6).

name: Beast Call
reference: Please see page 51 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook, or page 46 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook, for details.
description: Beast calls are some of the more simple and effective tools used by hunters and trappers.
details: Using a beast call requires no skill check, but the beast being targeted must make an Average (3 Difficulty) Discipline check to resist the call. Recording a new call to the mechanism's memory requires an Average (3 Difficulty) Computers modified by any other environmental conditions (heavy background noise, atmosphere interference, etc.)

name: Riding Tack
reference: Please see page 47 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.[BR]      [I]Note: This tack can also be found as an attachment for a mount vehicle.

base_mods.misc_desc: Characters may ride beast without suffering bareback riding penalties.

description: Riding tack is a catchall term for the assorted bits of equipment needed to ride or control a beast.
details: Tack can only be worn by riding or working animals. Using tack allows a character to ride the beast without suffering the bareback riding penalties.

name: "Quickflash" Burning Gel
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: Burning gel is an electrochemical hull-breaching agent.
details: Exposure to burning gel deals damage to materials and sentient beings as if it were a weapon. It deals 10 damage and has the Burn 5 and Pierce 5 weapon qualities. Using burning gel requires no skill check. However, placing it effectively might, at the GM's discretion, require a Mechanics check.

name: Chem Lure
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: Using pheromones, CorChemCo's Beastmaster Chem Lure attracts beasts to a place where they can be easily captured or killed.
details: Creatures targeted by the Beastmaster must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Discipline check check to resist approaching quickly to investigate. This equipment is often used with electro-snares or other live-trapping equipment to capture exotic animals for use as pets, zoo animals, and research subjects. Using the Beastmaster does not require a skill check, although placing it in the best position might, at the GM's discretion, require a Survival check.

name: Excavator's Precision Tool Kit
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This kit is primarily used by archeologists investigating ancient ruins and otherwise fragile artifacts uncovered from the wilderness. The tools are built to reduce possible damage to these precious findings.

name: Specimen Container, Tiny
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Specimen Container, Small
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Specimen Container, Medium
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Speciman Container, Large
reference: Please see page 52 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: Savior Anti-Grav Chute
reference: Please see page 103 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Take no wound or strain from falls

name: EVA Power Suit
reference: Please see page 103 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Ignore penalty for movement in zero-G environments

name: Gravity Belt
reference: Please see page 103 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Entrenching Tool
reference: Please see page 59 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook, or page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook, for details.
description: The modest and versatile entrenching tool is one of the most critically important tools in a Warrior's kit.
details: Besides allowing the user to dig holes and trenches, an entrenching tool counts as a small improvised weapon that deals +2 damage, has a critical rating of 4, and does not break due to Threat or Despair results.

name: Military Belt Pouch
reference: Please see page 59 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can hold two items of encumbrance 0.

description: This pouch, attached to one's belt, is designed for quick and easy access - to be used in the midst of battle where each second is valuable.

name: Model 58 Concealment Holster
reference: Please see page 59 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [SETBACK] to all Perception checks to discover concealed weapon.  Only usable for light and holdout blaster pistols.

description: This compact holster is built to help a small blaster's concealment, while also providing for an easy drawing and holstering when faced with hostile action.

name: Military Pack
reference: Please see page 59 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Cumbersome 2

description: This backpack, a standard issue by the military, is used to carry all sorts of field equipment without adding to a soldier's overall load. However, it is relatively bulky and may cause issues with the frail species.

name: Sleight Box (Very Large)
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.
Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something concealed in box.

name: Sleight Box (Large)
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.
Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something concealed in box.

name: Sleight Box (Medium)
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.
Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something concealed in box.

name: Sleight Box (Small)
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.
Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something concealed in box.

name: Sleight Box (Tiny)
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.
Requires [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to find something concealed in box.

name: Custom Tool Kit
reference: Please see page 45 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Owners gain [BOOST] and non-owners gain [SETBACK] on checks to maintain or repair any item.

description: For every job there is a proper tool, and the bigger the job, the more tools a technician needs.
details: Using a custom tool kit grants the user for whom it was built a Blue Boost die to any skill check made to maintain or repair an item, computer, weapon, vehicle, or starship. A character attempting to use custom tools made for someone else suffers a Black Setback die to the same checks. Custom tools can be customized for another user with extensive, and often expensive, modification.

name: AG/L Mk. III Targeting Goggles
reference: Please see page 45 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Count the silhouette of target as one greater when making Gunnery checks against a starship or vehicle.

name: Workshop Manual
reference: Please see page 46 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Downgrade difficulty of checks to maintain or repair vehicle or starship manual was written for.

description: The Foreman-Series workshop manual is produced by Verpine Chiles-Zraii consortium is specifically written to detail each vessel ever produced. Each book only covers a single vessel, and they are bought separately.

name: Ardos Disk
reference: Please see page 111 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BO][BO] to Charm or Negotiation checks made with Hutts.  If rival clan, upgrade difficulty of Charm or Negotiation checks.

description: These disks are small coins or medals produced and distributed by the Hutt clans to members under their protection. They provide safe passage through Hutt space and a hearing with most Hutt leaders.

name: Credit Cleaner
reference: Please see page 111 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Trace route of currency protected by credit cleaner is a [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].

description: Credits are generally traceable, with a certified scanner one can identify the transactions and owner of the credits over time. This equipment siphons the credits in and out of the economy to completely obfuscate its origin.

name: P-2 Pocket Attaché
reference: Please see page 111 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Slicing requires a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b]. If unsuccessful, data is wiped and lost forever.

reference: Please see page 183 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.

name: Data Breaker
reference: Please see page 186 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to any Computers check made to slice computers

description: The data breaker is a brute force tool used by slicers to hack into most computer systems and make it easier to find sought information.

name: Blackops Data Breaker
reference: Please see page 193 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to any Computers check made to slice computers
Adds [BOOST] to any attempt  to locate the use of a data breaker in a computer system

description: The data breaker is a brute force tool used by slicers to hack into most computer systems and make it easier to find sought information.

name: Flesh Camouflage Set
reference: Please see page 186 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 193 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: This is a comprehensive set of disguising equipment, capable of changing one's physical appearance and biological signature almost completely for a short time.

name: Personal Stealth Field
reference: Please see page 186 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 195 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

base_mods.misc_desc: Cannot be seen visually.  All other means of detecting location use [B]Formidible ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) difficulty[b].

description: The ultimate in personal stealth technology, personal stealth fields are rare and expensive, and well worth the price.
details: PSF users cannot be detected by sight, and any skill checks to detect them by other means, such as scent, motion, or sound, have a difficulty of Formidable (5 Difficulty). The GM may use any Threat or Despair result generated while a character uses a personal stealth field to indicate that the field flickers for a moment or collapses altogether, rendering the user visible.

name: Dataspike
reference: Please see page 51 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to any Computers check made to slice computers
Adds [BOOST] to any attempt  to locate the use of a data breaker in a computer system

description: Dataspikes, also known as computer spikes, are a common tool for bypassing computer security.
details: Once per round, a character with a dataspike may expend it to attempt to disable a security program as a maneuver (rather than as an action). [...] Reduce the difficulty of subsequent Computers check to disable the program by 2, to a minimum of 0. After one use, the dataspike burns out and becomes useless.

name: Tracing Console
reference: Please see page 51 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] on attempts to slice a system protected by a tracing console.
Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to Computers checks to defend a system protected by a tracing console, or to identify intruder (e.g., Trace User action).

description: Tracing consoles are most commonly found with espionage agencies and other sensitive installations, but they could be used by any group concerned about the security of its electronic systems.
details: A tracing console can be installed to monitor a single system, such as a building's data network or a ship's computer. Computers checks to slice a system protected this way suffer a Black Setback die due to the difficulty of avoiding notice. A defending slicer using the console gains two Blue Boost dice to Computers checks to identify an intruder, such as by the Trace User action.

name: Signature Modulation Pad
reference: Please see page 51 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] on attempts to acquire user's slicing signature (e.g., Trace User action).

description: Tools designed to hide or disguise slicing signatures take many forms across the galaxy, as they are typically assembled in back-alley workshops or criminal facilities instead of reputable manufacturers.
details: Add two Black Setback dice to checks attempting to acquire the user's slicing signature, such as the Trace User action.

name: Demon Mask
reference: Please see page 190 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Characters making Discipline checks to resist fear caused by a character wearing a Demon Mask add [SETBACK] equal to that character’s Force rating.

name: Meditation Focus
reference: Please see page 190 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Talisman of Iron Fists
reference: Please see page 190 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Bardottan Sphere
reference: Please see page 109 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: One of the most powerful objects ever encounter by the legendary Jedi Master Mace Windu was the Bardottan Sphere, a Force artifact designed to capture the Force from living beings and store it as though in some battery.
details: While the Sphere is in a character's possession, the character's Force rating increases by one. If the character sacrifices a being to store its life force in the Sphere, then the character's Force rating increases by the Force rating of the sacrificed being, as long as that creature's Force rating was 1 or higher. However, a character who uses the Sphere during a session gains 5 Conflict at the at the end of the session, in addition to any Conflict accrued due to any sacrifices the character makes to power the Sphere.

name: Crown of Verity
reference: Please see page 110 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character who wears the crown automatically fails all Deception checks and gains [SU][SU][SU] on checks to detect lies or to determine if someone is telling the truth.

description: In the days of the Republic and even before, the Outer Rim world of Auratera, little visited now, attracted the attention of Force users from all over the galaxy.
details: A Force-sensitive character who dons the Crown of Verity automatically fails all Deception checks while wearing it. At the same time, they gain three automatic Success results on any checks to detect lies or determine whether someone is telling the truth.

name: Dram of Orphne
reference: Please see page 111 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character heals 1 additional strain at the end of an encounter.
A Force-sensitive character heals 1 additional wound during natural rest.
Add [BO] to Medicine checks made to heal another character.

description: The curious Mid Rim planet of Aleen has long been speculated to be a place with a strong natural resonance with the Force.
details: A Force-sensitive character who possesses the Dram of Orphne heals 1 additional strain at the end of an encounter. A Force-sensitive character who posses the Dram of Orphne also heals 1 additional wound when benefiting from natural rest. Finally, when making a Medicine check to heal another character, any character with the Dram of Orphne may add a Blue Boost die to the check.

name: Dolina Ring Seeds
reference: Please see page 113 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character may perform one free Move maneuver per turn.  This can allow a character to perform three maneuvers in one turn.

description: The swampy world of Dagobah has been erased from galactic charts, but the rare visitors of times part brough away samples of the planet's unique flora and fauna.
details: A Force-sensitive character who possesses a dolina ring seed may perform one free Move maneuver during each of [their] turns. This Move maneuver may be in addition to any other maneuvers performed this turn and can allow the character to perform three maneuvers in a turn. (The user also ignores the ring seed's weight.)

name: Eyes of Laqasa
reference: Please see page 108 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character removes all [SE] imposed due to darkness, concealment, camouflage, or similar effects.
A Force-sensitive character can see in the dark as if in normal daylight.

description: The Jedi Knight Laqasa Trill was a Devaronian woman and an incredibly skilled hunter, excelling at an activity more often practiced by Devaronian men.
details: When wearing the Eyes of Laqasa, Force-sensitive characters remove all Black Setback dice imposed due to darkness, concealment, camouflage, or similar effects, and can see normally as in normal daylight.

name: Grimoire of Syclos the Lame
reference: Please see page 107 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character may add [FO] to all Force power or Force talent checks when dealing with creatures detailed in the Grimoire  This effect lasts for the game session.
Until the end of the game session, a Force-sensitive character upgrades Fear checks while confronting creatures detailed in the Grimoire twice.  Conflict due to a [DE] result is doubled.

description: Whereas most citizens of other planets believe the Force to be but a legend, on the Wild Space planet of Weik, the Force is known to exist without a doubt.
details: Studying the Grimoire of Syclos the Lame for at least one hour allows a Force-sensitive character to add a White Force die to all Force power checks or checks involving Force talents when dealing with creatures detailed in the Grimoire. The bonus lasts until the end of the game session. (What creatures the bonus applies to is ultimately up to the GM, as some creatures may not be covered in the Grimoire). However, until the end of the game session, the difficulty of all fear checks made while confronting these creatures is upgraded twice. Any Conflict generated by a Despair result on a fear check is doubled.

name: Herder's Gauntlet
reference: Please see page 110 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: The Iktotchi people are blessed with the talents of precognition, an ability found to benefit from augmentation by the Force when their world was incorporated into the Republic thousands of years ago.
details: A Force-sensitive character who wears the Herder's Gauntlet counts as possessing the Move basic power, and may make a Move Force power action as a maneuver. A character who does so many not attack an opponent with this use of the Force power (what constitutes an attack is ultimately up to the GM, but should include disarming or incapacitating opponents as well as dealing damage).

name: Taradon's Helm
reference: Please see page 112 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A Force-sensitive character may reroll one [FO] when making checks involving piloting or using a starship or vehicle.

description: Somewhere in the icy wastes of Ilum, the wreckage of a starfighter serves as the tomb of the Jedi Taradon, a Corellian human possessed of extraordinary prowess as a pilot.
details: A Force-sensitive character who possesses Taradon's Helm may reroll one White Force die when making checks that involve piloting or using a starship or vehicle. If there is some question as to whether the check involves piloting or using a starship or vehicle, the GM is the final arbiter.

name: Tear of the Elders
reference: Please see page 107 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Once per session, a Force-sensitive character may make a Force power check.  He may spend [FP][FP] to detect one threat the PC is likely going to encounter during the session.

description: Before humans ever came to Naboo, another starfaring species discovered the Gungans in Naboo's swamps and seas.
details: Once per game session, when a Force-sensitive character holds the Tear of the Elders, the character may make a Force power check. As part of this check, the character may spend two Light Points and/or Dark Points to detect one threat the PC is likely to encounter during the current game session. The GM has the final say as to what this threat is and how the character perceives it. The Force user could see the threat clearly, or in a metaphorical sense. A battalion of stormtroopers, for instance, might appear as a solid white wall, impossible to penetrate, while a dark side Force user might manifest as a figure formed out of storm clouds, lightning flickering malevolently within.

name: Sample Holocron
reference:
This is a sample holocron. This holocron does the following:
  • Makes Ranged - Light a career skill
  • Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to Vigilance checks
  • Grants 2 ranks in the Sleight of Mind talent
Please see page 190 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for more details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to Vigilance checks

name: Holocron of Outer Rim and  Piloting Space
reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Holocron of Brawl and Streetwise
reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
