name: Holocron of Skulduggery and Vigilance
reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Holocron of Xenology and Survival
reference: See [B]Table 2-7: Holocron Skills[b] on page 109 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Sanctuary Holocron
reference: Please see page 439 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When making a Knowledge (Lore) check to learn about the Jedi, the PCs may use the holocron to make an assisted check. The holocron counts as having three ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

name: Suljo Warde's Holocron
reference: See page 19 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper adventure module for details.

name: Appraiser's Eye
reference: Please see page 48 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Provides automatic [AD] on Negotiation and Streetwise checks to buy or sell items.

description: To negotiate with clients successfully, a smuggler must be able to recall the rough market value for a staggering number of goods on dozens, if not hundreds, of different worlds.
details: An appraiser's eye provides an automatic Advantage result on Negotiation and Streetwise checks to buy or sell items.

name: Cybernetic Cavity
reference: Please see page 48 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: Sometimes a smuggler needs to traffic contraband through extremely vigorous security checkpoints. This implant allows one to hide items inside their body in a safe way.

name: Digital Lockpick
reference: Please see page 48 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: This prosthetic replaces a finger with a set of deployable small tools that allow one to get through both physical and digital locks.

name: Holoscanner (10 Encumbrance)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduces the difficulty of Perception or Vigilance checks to discover concealed items by two.  Cannot scan an item with encumbrance higher than 10.

name: Holoscanner (100 Encumbrance)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduces the difficulty of Perception or Vigilance checks to discover concealed items by two.  Cannot scan an item with encumbrance higher than 100.

name: Lockpicking Tools
reference: Please see page 49 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: While most locks in the galaxy rely on an electrical component, there exists locations and cultures without a steady supply of electricity.
details: A lockpick set counts as a Tool Kit for the purposes of opening mechanical and simple electrical locks.

name: Shift Coffer
reference: Please see page 49 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When coffer is in its wall niche, attempts to dicover it require a [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b].
Locks require a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b] to pick.

description: Also known as "Bith Hiding Cubes", these containers are slotted into walls or their environment, being virtually invisible to a bypasser. They also refract light around them when outside the slot, causing a blurred effect around them but rendering them invisible.

name: Magna-Lock Safe
reference: Please see page 49 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Cracking requires specialized tools and a [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b].

description: Considered one of the best personal safes on the market, the magna-lock mechanism makes it nearly impossible to open this safe - even with specialised tools.

name: Shadowcloak
reference: Please see page 49 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Discerning identifiable features requires a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b].

description: Shadowcloaks are peculiar devices designed to protect a user's anonymity during meetings in person.
details: Discerning any identifiable features of a character wearing a shadowcloak requires a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Perception check. If the wearer has performed a Move maneuver in that round (or was moved by some other means), the check is reduced to Hard (3 Difficulty).

name: Fingerprint Masque
reference: Please see page 50 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Fool fingerprint readers: [B]Easy ([DI]) to Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Cool or Deception checks[b]. [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to notice a worn fingerprint masque.

description: For those who are serious about keeping their identity unknown, fingerprint masques are essential.
details: Fingerprint masques can fool basic fingerprint readers with nothing more than an Easy (1 Difficulty) Cool or Deception check, while more advanced scanners require an Average (2 Difficulty) or Hard (3 Difficulty) check, at the GM's discretion. If the biometric scanner operator has reason to be suspicious of a character wearing a fingerprint masque, it may require an opposed social skill check vs. Computers against the operator. A character must make a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Perception check to actually notice the physical presence of a fingerprint masque on an individual's fingers.

name: Skifter
reference: Please see page 50 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When gambling, using a skifter gains [BO] to Skulduggery checks to cheat.

description: This is one of the most common tools used to cheat at Sabacc, used by many scoundrels to tip the odds of a gamble in their favour.

name: Cargo Scanner
reference: Please see page 50 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to increase the available encumbrance capacity of vehicle with silhouette 3+ by 10% (rounding up).

description: This scanner is as important to a smuggler as their blaster. The scanner runs a set of algorithms upon inputting cargo container specifications and the vessel's schematics - allowing the user to determine the most efficient way to store items in their cargo hold.

name: Impact (Dose)
reference: Please see page 50 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Upgrade the ability of any Agility-based checks until the end of the encounter.  After encounter, suffer [SE] to any Agility-, Cunning-, or Intellect-based checks for the remainder of session.

name: Impact (100 dose cargo container)
reference: Please see page 50 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Upgrade the ability of any Agility-based checks until the end of the encounter.  After encounter, suffer [SE] to any Agility-, Cunning-, or Intellect-based checks for the remainder of session.

name: Muon Gold (Dose)
reference: Please see page 51 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO] to all Cunning- and Presence-based checks until end of encounter.

name: Muon Gold (100 dose cargo container)
reference: Please see page 51 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO] to all Cunning- and Presence-based checks until end of encounter.

name: Expensive Jewelry
reference: Please see page 51 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add automatic [AD] to Charm and Deception checks.
Others add [BO] to checks to recall the wearer.

description: Wealth and authority has traditionally gone hand in hand. It is no surprise that when one flaunts their wealth, they often are treated as a member of high status.

name: Signet Ring
reference: Please see page 53 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add automatic [AD][AD] to checks to establish identity.

description: When the Paladins of the Adamite Tower agree to accept a new member into their ranks, they present that individual with one of the extremely rare blades of their order.
details: Possessing a signet ring signifies to anyone on Weik that the character is one of the Paladins of the Adamite Tower. Possessing a signet ring under false pretenses earns the lasting enmity of all Paladins and their allies.

name: Adamite Signet Ring
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: When the Paladins of the Adamite Tower agree to accept a new member into their ranks, they present that individual with one of the extremely rare blades of their order.
details: Possessing a signet ring signifies to anyone on Weik that the character is one of the Paladins of the Adamite Tower. Possessing a signet ring under false pretenses earns the lasting enmity of all Paladins and their allies.

name: BPEA-1A Cascader
reference: Please see page 44 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When wearing a Cascader, upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Leadership checks by one.

description: Developed by Coruscant-based boutique electronics firm Farbreini MicroElectronics Ltd., the BPEA-IA Cascader was designed to give those who live in the public eye an extra level of control over their appearance.
details: When wearing a Cascader, a PC upgrades all Charm. Deception, and Leadership checks they make once.

name: Dress Uniform
reference: Please see page 44 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.
description: Equal parts formal attire from a variety of worlds and functional military uniform, an assortment of dress uniforms are worn for ceremonial purposes by Alliance Military personnel.

name: Ribbon Rack
reference: Please see page 44 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.
description: A ribbon rack is typically worn with a dress uniform to display the various decorations earned by the wearer.

name: Symbol of Command
reference: Please see page 44 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Commanders carrying a symbol add [BO] to social checks with other military personnel.

description: Alliance Commanders hail from numerous human, near-human, and alien cultures from throughout the galaxy.
details: No matter what form the item takes, Commanders carrying a symbol of command add a Blue Boost die to all Social skill checks made to interact with others brought up in their particular military culture.

name: CZ-88 Heavy Loader Arm
reference: Please see page 51 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Droid brain: Brawn 5, Athletics 1 ([PR][AB][AB][AB][AB]).

description: The CZ-88 model heavy loader produced by Czerka is a flexible piece of equipment used for everything from moving freight to collecting salvage to replacing damaged hull plating on starships.
details: A heavy loader arm includes a monotask droid brain that can perform checks to heft objects; it has an Athletics skill of 1 and a Brawn of 5 (if unassisted, it rolls one Proficiency and four Ability dice for Athletics checks). Sometimes, salvagers install loader arms directly onto starships or other vehicles for easy retrieval of scrap metal and other components, using the arm as a low-cost alternative to a tractor beam projector. A CZ-88 heavy loader arm can be installed onto a vehicle of silhouette 3 or larger as an attachment, and uses one hard point. The occupants of the craft can use it to perform Athletics checks to lift objects into or out of the vessel (and other checks, at the GM's discretion) without disembarking.

name: Mechanical Dianoga
reference: Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE][SE] from checks to remove system strain from starships and vehicles.

description: Designed for reaching tight spaces in a starship, the mechanical dianoga is a meter-and-a-half-long flexible actuated tube.
details: A mechanical dianoga removes two Black Setback dice from checks to remove system strain from starships and vehicles.

name: VX-A Intelligent Toolbox
reference: Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Counts as a tool kit.
Reduces time for repairs, crafting, or other Mechanics-related tasks by 50%.

name: OR-Series Tech Recycling Station
reference: Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to Perception and Mechanics checks to scavenge parts or raw materials.  Checks can be completed in half the time (or a quarter of the time with the Utinni! talent).
May recover supplies worth half of the Material Price from any failed crafting check.

description: Tech recycling stations are used to speed up the time-consuming task of sifting through damaged or discarded technology to find items of value.
details: A character using a tech recycling stations adds two Blue Boost dice to Perception and Mechanics checks to scavenge parts or raw materials, and can complete such checks in half the time (or one quarter of the time with the Utinni! talent talent). Additionally, a character with a tech recycling station on hand may recover supplied worth half of the Material Price from any failed crafting check, to a maximum of the full value.

name: Repulsor Clamp
reference: Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can hold a single object of 10 encumbrance or less aloft.
Removes [SE] from checks to repair hull trauma and Critical Hits on starships and vehicles.

description: This pneumatic clamp, attached to a repulsor engine, allows Technicians to hold heavy objects in the air as they work on repairs.
details: A repulsor clamp can hold a single object of 10 encumbrance or less aloft. Further, having a repulsor clamp on hand removes a Black Setback die from checks to repair hull trauma and Critical Hits on starships and vehicles.

name: 3-MAL Secure Comlink
reference: Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE] to any check made to intercept and unscramble its signal.
Add [BO][BO] to Knowledge checks related to current events or conditions at the GM's discretion.

description: Popular throughout the Rebel Alliance, the 3-MAL comlink is a versatile comms system squeezed into a tiny, pill-shaped package.
details: This comlink transmits up to medium range on the planetary scale. The 3-MAL's encryption adds a Black Setback die to any check made to intercept and unscramble the signal. Monitoring a standard clear frequency on a civilized world can add two Blue Boost dice to Knowledge checks related to current events or conditions at the Game Master's discretion.

name: DH77 Headcomm
reference: Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE][SE][SE] to any attempt to intercept and unscramble its signal.

description: Standard issue for Imperial Army platoon leaders and also installed inside stormtrooper helmets, SoroSuub's DH77 headcomm is an easy to use system with complex encryption subroutines.
details: This comlink transmits up to medium range on the planetary scale. The DH77's constantly shifting encryption adds three Black Setback dice to any attempt to intercept and unscramble the signal.

name: Atgar Artillery Remote
reference: Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Make a [B]Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] ([B]Average([DI][DI])[b] if weapon is an Atgar SpaceDefense model) to link a single Gunnery weapon.  If success, weapon gains Inaccurate 2 and holder can fire the linked weapon via remote from up to medium range.

name: Low-Feedback Scanner
reference: Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can detect radiation of silhouette 1 within short range, life forms within medium range, power sources within long range, and comms signals within extreme range.  Increase range band by 1 for every silhouette size higher than 1.

description: CryonCorp designed the low-feedback scanner specifically for Gotals and members of other species sensitive to the electromagnetic spectrum.
details: This sensor can detect radiation sources of silhouette 1 or larger within short range, life forms within medium range, power sources within long range, and comms signals within extreme range. Extend the range of detection by 1 range band for every silhouette size by which the target's size exceeds silhouette 1.

name: SE-Vigilant Automated Sensor
reference: Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

name: Nullcaine
reference: Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May apply to self or engaged character by making an [B]Easy ([DI]) Medicine check[b] and choosing one [B]Easy ([DI])[b], [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b], or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] Critical Injury on the target.  If successful, target suffers 3 strain and ingores effect of Critical Injury until the end of the encounter.

name: Stimstick
reference: Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE] from Discipline, Perception, Resilience, or Vigilance checks to stay awake or notice something due to fatigue or lack of sleep until end of encounter.  At end of encounter, target suffers 1 strain.

description: Throughout history, the most basic form of security against intrusion has come in the form of observant sentries.
details: A character who chews a stimstick removes a Black Setback die from their Discipline, Perception, Resilience, or Vigilance checks to stay awake or notice something due to fatigue or lack of sleep until the end of the encounter. At the end of the encounter, the character suffers 1 strain.

name: Military Trauma Pack
reference: Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can only be used to use Medicine skill to attempt to remove Critical Injuries from others without penalty, but no other treatment options, as specified on page 232 of the [B]Age of Rebellion[b] Core Rulebook.

name: Condenser Unit
reference: Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can gather enough water each day to sustain one person.  Batteries last six months.

description: Condensers use vaporator technology to provide both fresh water and a smokeless heat source in one portable package.
details: [...] A condenser can collect enough water each day to sustain a single individual, and its power cell lasts roughly six months.

name: Portable Power Generator
reference: Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May recharge a depleted piece of equipment as a maneuver, or a droid or larger piece of machinery in an hour.
Engaged character may ignore "out of ammo" [DE] results in the same manner as an Extra Reload.

description: For most armies, power is just as important as ammunition, food, and bandages.
details: A portable generators can recharge a depleted piece of equipment as a maneuver, or a droid or larger piece of machinery in an hour. Additionally, a portable power generator can allow an engaged character to ignore an "out of ammo" Despair result in the same manner as an Extra Reload; the generator is usually not depleted by such use, except at the GM's discretion.

name: Pretormin Plastent
reference: Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE][SE] to checks to resist hostile temperatures while sleeping in tent, and downgrades difficulty of such checks once.

description: Alliance standard issue, this triangular two-meter tent inflates and anchors in minutes, and sleeps up to four.
details: Sleeping in a plastent removes two Black Setback dice from the user's checks to resist hostile temperatures while sleeping, and downgrades the difficulty of any such checks once.

name: Military Modular Backpack Frame
reference: Please see page 55 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.      [BR][I]Note: To purchase modules for the modular backpack frame, select the frame in your inventory and click the "Attachments" button.  An "attachment" will be available for adding a variety of modules to the backpack.  Up to two modules may be added.[i]

name: Imperial Officer's Cap
reference: Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BO] to Coercion checks targeting Imperial troops.

name: Stormtrooper Helmet/ComLink
reference: Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE] from checks made to intercept, interpret, or imitate Imperial communications.

name: Imperial Intelligence Badge
reference: Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BO][BO] to Fear checks caused by Imperial operatives to himself and all allies within short range.

name: Karrak Spice (1 dose)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours.  Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

name: Karrak Spice (100 doses)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours.  Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

name: Questioner-9 (100 doses)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Five minute delay.  Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.

name: Questioner-9 (1 dose)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Five minute delay.  Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.

name: Yaladai Spice (1 dose)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain,  suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1).  Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].

name: Yaladai Spice (100 doses)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain,  suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1).  Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].

name: Infrabinoculars
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can see through up to two meters of wall.  Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).

description: Infrabinoculars are specialized tools designed to enhance awareness in urban evironments.
details: A character using infrabinoculars can see through can see through up to two meters of wall, possibly allowing surveillance of a whole building at once. Walls made of dense materials or constructed to shield their interiors may impose one or more Black Setback dice on Perception checks. Some models of infrabinoculars can alternate between this infrared sensor package and a long-range view equivalent to that of electrobinoculars.

name: Infrabinoculars (Long Range)
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can see through up to two meters of wall.  Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).
User may see in low light or extreme bright light conditions.
Magnifies targetets up to 10 kilometers away.
User may remove [SE] imposed due to long range or low light.

name: Microdroid Listener
reference: Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Planting this device unnoticed requires an [B]opposed Skulduggery vs. Vigilance check[b].  Once planted, requires a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to locate.

description: These tiny spiderlike automata, little more than mobile audio bugs, are barely worth the name "droid."
details: Planting this device without being noticed requires an opposed Skulduggery check vs. Vigilance. Once the bug is in place, a character must make a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Vigilance check to locate it even when they are specifically searching for one. The microdroid has no self-defense or evasive capabilities, although some manufacturers fit their models with a self-destruct in case of tampering.

name: Privacy-7 Audio Curtain
reference: Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Listening to a conversation protected by curtain requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to understand anything said.  [TH] or [DE] may be spent to misunderstand key words or phrases.

description: This is one of a wide range of products marketed to beings interested in privacy and discretion.
details: Characters attempting to listen in on a conversation which is being obscured by one or more audio curtains must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Perception check to understand anything being said. The GM can spend a Threat or Despair result to have the character misunderstand key words or phrases.

name: Model 31 Palm Stunner
reference: Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Use on unaware target with [B]opposed Skulduggery vs. Resilience check[b].  Success incapacitates a minion or deals 12 strain to rival or nemesis.  Each [SU] adds 1 damage.

description: This high-output stun weapon by Merr-Sonn takes the form of a flat lens small enough to conceal in the palm of a hand.
details: A character can use a palm stunner on an unaware target with an opposed Skulduggery check. A successful check automatically incapacitates a minion or deals 12 damage to the strain threshold of a rival or nemesis. In addition, each Success result on the opposed Stealth check increases the damage dealt by one.

name: Scramble Key
reference: Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Bypasses simple locks within 5 minutes.  May attempt [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b] to speed up process.  Each [SU] reduces time by one minute.  Failure triggers alerm.  Force users may add power check, adding [SU] or [AD] for each [FP] generated.

description: Breaking into a facility secured with an electronic lock usually requires a knowledgeable slicer, but the galactic underworld has invented myriad ways to perform the task in the absence of such personnel.
details: A scramble key bypasses most simple electronic locks within five minutes of application. At the Game Master's discretion, more complicated locks may require additional time to crack or might trigger alarms at the brute force incursion. The user may attempt to speed up this process with a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Skulduggery check, relying on pure intuition to select the correct code from those the scramble key generates. Success reduces the time needed to crack a common lock to a single minute, but failure immediately triggers any relevant alarms. Force-sensitive characters may make a Force power check as part of this check, adding either a Success or Advantage result for each Light Point or Dark Point generated.

name: Disaster Relief Kit
reference: Please see page 50 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May sustain a character for a week to ten days with rationing.

description: These compact containers for use in relief efforts when catastrophe strikes inhabited regions, from the largest cities to the most isolated villages.
details: A single disaster relief kit can sustain the basic needs of four individuals of most known species for a week, or potentially up to ten days with careful rationing.

name: Foot Speeder
reference: Please see page 50 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.[P][I]Note: This item is also included as a vehicle.[i]
description: These curious contraptions combine the swiftness of a speeder car with an easy of storage and simple construction that makes keeping and maintaining them much less expensive than doing so for an actual vehicle.
details: A foot speeder allows a person to function as a Silhouette 1, Speed 1, Handling –1, System Strain Threshold 4 vehicle that can only operate in atmosphere, and requires Piloting - Planetary to operate. It has a flight ceiling of five meters.

name: Repulsor Assist Unit
reference: Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduces difficulty to climb by 2, to minimum of 0.
May attach to cargo to reduce encumbrance by 7.

description: Some models of grappling hook and climbing harness rely on forces other than sheer muscle power for operation.
details: A character using a repulsor assist unit reduces the difficulty to climb by 2 (to a minimum of 0). A repulsor assist unit can also be attached to a cargo to reduce the encumbrance value of the cargo by 7.

name: Urban Compass
reference: Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: In urban environments, remove [SE][SE] from checks due to unfamiliarity, traffic, or other travel hazards.
Grants [BO] to checks to find information about an urban environment, including city operations, landmarks, and businesses.

description: While constructed around common datapads, urban compasses are more specialized tools.
details: Individuals using an urban compass to find their way around a city remove two Black Setback dice from checks due to unfamiliarity with the city, traffic, or other avoidable travel hazards. Additionally, an urban compass can turn up information on local establishments and customs, granting a Blue Boost die to checks to find information about the city's operation, various landmarks of note, and businesses of all types.

name: Bioscan
reference: Please see page 53 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When scanning for life signs, grants [BO] to [B]Perception vs. Stealth checks[b].
Verifying identity requires an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b] and a biometric identifier.

description: {{DISPLAYTITLE:Bioscan}}
details: Using a bioscan to scan an area for life signs grants a Blue Boost die to any opposed Perception checks vs Stealth check. Using the device to verify a person's identity requires an Average (3 Difficulty) Computers and a biometric identifier (such as DNA or a record of physiological characteristics) for comparison. The Game Master may modify this difficulty based upon any unusual anatomical characteristics of the target's species.

name: Holonet Homing Beacon
reference: Please see page 53 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Bounty hunters and others engaging in a pursuit may need to track their quarry across tremendous distances, including through hyperspace.
details: As long as a homing beacon is functional, the person who activated it may trace the associated target across the galaxy. No skill checks are required as long as the target travels within known systems. A homing beacon remains functional indefinitely unless it is deactivated.

name: Rocket Boots
reference: Please see page 53 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.[P][I]Note:  For the vehicle version of this item, see the vehicle of the same name.[i]
description: The ability to take flight without warning can provide a combatant with a huge advantage over an opponent.
details: Rocket boots enable a person to function as a silhouette 1, speed 1, handling 3, system strain threshold 4 vehicle that can only operate in atmosphere and requires Piloting - Planetary to operate. At the end of each round of use, rocket boots suffer 1 system strain as their fuel depletes.

name: Tracker's Goggles
reference: Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BO] to Perception checks to locate a target by sight.
Removes [SE][SE] imposed due to concealment, darkness, or fog/mist from Ranged (Light) and Ranged (Heavy) combat checks.

description: Tracker's goggles are marketed primarily to wilderness enthusiasts and hunters of traditional game animals.
details: Tracker's goggles grant a Blue Boost die to the wearer's Perception checks to locate a target by sight. Additionally, they remove two Black Setback dice imposed due to concealment, darkness, fog, or mist from the wearer's Ranged - Light and Ranged - Heavy checks.

name: Com-Scan
reference: Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can trianguate location and movement of a known comlink or transeiver within close range (planetary) with an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check.[b]

description: Nearly every person and vehicle carries a comlink or a transceiver.

name: Holographic Disguise Matrix
reference: Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to Deception checks to impersonate target.
Add [SE][SE] to onlookers' Perception checks to detect imposter.

description: When setting a trap or infiltrating a facility, altering one's appearance grants a huge advantage.

name: Saline Pump
reference: Please see page 55 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO] to Clawdite's checks to pass himself off as another person.
Add [SE] to others' checks to detect the Clawdite's deception.

description: Clawdites adjust their shape by moving fluid through their body, and reorganizing the structures on their skin's surface.

name: Sleeppack (one dose)
reference: Please see page 55 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Applying to an aware target requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Brawl[b] or[B]Melee check[b].
Victim must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] or take 10 strain damage.

name: Repulsor Trap
reference: Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.
description: These traps for sentient beings subvert repulsorlift technology to create localized patches of extremely high gravity.
details: Repulsor traps are unobtrusive, adding two Black Setback dice to all Perception checks made to notice these devices. Any single target who comes within engaged range of an active repulsor trap is ensnared for six rounds.

name: Explosive Implant
reference: Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Locate the implanted target using handheld device with a [B]Simple (-) Computers check[b].
A [B]Daunting ([CH][DI][DI][DI]) Medicine[b] or [B]Mechanics check[b] is required to remove implant.  [TH] alerts transmitter of tampering, and [DE] triggers device.

description: Slavers and slaveholders do not always keep slaves locked up in chains while they carry out their duties.
details: A corresponding handheld device similar to a droid caller can locate the implanted target with a Simple Computers check. With the press of a button, the implant can explode, instantly killing its victim. A (once upgraded) Daunting (4 Difficulty) Medicine or Mechanics check is required remove the implant. However, a Threat result alerts the transmitter of the tampering, and a Despair result triggers the device.

name: Stun Collar
reference: Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When remotely activated to subdue, inflicts 10 stun damage.
When remotely activated to be lethal, inflicts 12 damage and a Critical Injury at +20.
Removing collar without shocking its wearer requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b].

description: Slavers and slaveholders do not always keep slaves locked up in chains while they carry out their duties.
details: When activated via remote, the stun collar delivers a high-voltage shock to its wearer, inflicting ten Stun damage. However, the collar can also be used to lethal effect, dealing twelve damage and inflicting a Critical Injury adding +20 to the roll. A Hard (3 Difficulty) Mechanics check is necessary to remove the collar without electrocuting its wearer.
